intro: Matthiola glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular stock, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its glandular-pubescent leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces clusters of small, four-petaled flowers in shades of white, pink, or purple. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or disturbed habitats. Matthiola glandulosa is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in perfumery and herbal medicine.
